info.title: Myriad Playout v6 by Broadcast Radio

get.summary: Returns the basic status of Myriad Playout and any open Stations
Returns the exact version of Myriad Playout
Returns the ProfileName that Myriad was started with. The default is "Profile1"

put.summary: Executes the specified command. See the Command Documentation for more details

get.summary: Returns the details of the active Myriad Station Database
Returns the currently selected Favourites Set
Gets the specified Favourites Set
Gets a list of all available Sets for the specified type
Plays the specified Favourite by Index or MediaId from the currently selected set.

parameters.name: favouriteIndex
parameters.description: Play this specific Favourite from the current set

parameters.name: mediaId
parameters.description: Play a specific media item from the Current set, or dynamically if not assigned to the current set

get.summary: Cues the specified Favourite by Index or MediaId from the currently selected set.

parameters.name: favouriteIndex
parameters.description: Cue this specific Favourite from the current set

parameters.name: mediaId
parameters.description: Cue a specific media item from the Current set, or dynamically if not assigned to the current set

get.summary: Reads the current state of the specified line on the specified device

parameters.name: deviceIndex
parameters.description: The device index - starts at zero

post.summary: Sets the the specified line on the specified device to the new lineState

parameters.name: deviceIndex
parameters.description: The device index - starts at zero

post.summary: Sets the specified line on the specified device to the new lineState

parameters.name: deviceIndex
parameters.description: The device index - starts at zero

parameters.name: pulseDurationSeconds
parameters.description: The duration of the pulse, in seconds.  Can be a non-whole number, e.g. 2.75. Minimum is 0.001

get.summary:
Reads all the basic information for the items for the specified hours.

Avoid reading too many items in a single call to avoid causing performance issues during Playout

parameters.name: startSequenceBase
parameters.description: The first hour in the format yyyymmddhh

parameters.name: endSequenceBase
parameters.description: The final hour in the format yyyymmddhh

get.summary:
Reads all the item information for the specified hours.

Avoid reading too many items in a single call to avoid causing performance issues during Playout

parameters.name: startSequenceBase
parameters.description: The first hour in the format yyyymmddhh

parameters.name: endSequenceBase
parameters.description: The final hour in the format yyyymmddhh

post.summary: Sets the chain type for the specified Log Item

put.summary: Inserts a media Item at the specified index in an existing Log hour

parameters.name: logHourSequence
parameters.description: The hour in the format yyyymmddhh

put.summary:
Inserts a media Item immediately after the currently playing item.

The specified log must be running on this computer.

get.summary: Returns the specified Media Item. Use additionalInfo to request more detailed information
Reads multiple items in a single request. Limited to 1000 items per request.

parameters.name: attributesStationId
parameters.description: Specify -1 to use the current station

get.summary: Read all the items in a specified range. Limited to 1000 items per request.

parameters.name: attributesStationId
parameters.description: Specify -1 to use the current station

post.summary: Sets the Item' Extro for the specified Media ID to an exact time.
post.description:
The extroTime parameter is the time in seconds and must be between the Media Items' Overall Start and Overall End

The extroTime is the number of seconds from zero, so if the Media Item has an Overall Start set to 30 seconds, then setting an extroTime of 35 will result in setting the extro to 5 seconds after the Overall Start.

parameters.name: mediaId
parameters.description: Must be a valid ID for a non-empty media item

parameters.name: extroTime
parameters.description: The exact time for the extro in seconds.

post.summary: Sets the Item' Extro for the specified Media ID relative to it's overall end
post.description: The extroOffset parameter is the time in seconds and is the number of seconds before the overall end - e.g. 3.5 means 3.5 seconds before the overall end.

parameters.name: mediaId
parameters.description: Must be a valid ID for a non-empty media item

parameters.name: extroOffset
parameters.description: The number of seconds before the overall end

post.summary: Set the titling and/or artist information for the specified Media ID.
post.description:
You can clear fields by sending an empty string, omitting a field leaves the existing value in place.

You cannot clear the ItemTitle field.

parameters.name: mediaId
parameters.description: Must be a valid ID for a non-empty media item

post.summary: Set the Item Type for the specified Media ID, optionally also se the isSweeper state

parameters.name: mediaId
parameters.description: Must be a valid ID for a non-empty media item

parameters.name: newItemType
parameters.description: The new item type for the media item

get.summary: Gets the current OnAir control status for the specified station

post.summary: Requests Myriad to attempt to take OnAir control for the specified station
Tells Myriad to release OnAir control for the specified station

get.summary: Gets the Now Playing information for the specified station
Sets the Now Playing information for the specified station

put.summary: Sets the Now Playing information for the specified station

get.summary: Gets the current show and presenter information

put.summary: Sets the current show and presenter information

get.summary: Reads the state of the specified media player
Reads the state of all media players in the specified station

post.summary: Reloads the Media Engine Settings for the specified station. Currently only supported when using the StreamEngine
Forwards the ConnectToLiveEngine message onto the StreamEngine
Immediately cue and play the specified item in the first available player in a range, or in the specified player
Immediately cue the specified item in the first available player in a range, or in the specified player
Plays (or resumes) the specified player
Pauses the specified player
Recues the specified player
Seeks the specified player to the specified position in seconds
Seeks the specified player to the specified position in percent based on the full item (ignores MediaStart and MediaEnd)
Seeks the specified player to the specified position in seconds past the MediaStart.
Seeks the specified player to the specified position in percent from MediaStart to MediaEnd
Closes the media item in the specified player
Starts the next Log Item playing

parameters.name: itemIndex
parameters.description: Zero based index - 0 is the currently playing item

post.summary: Toggles the ending of the specified QAE Item.

parameters.name: itemIndex
parameters.description: Zero based index - 0 is the currently playing item

post.summary: Sets the ending of the specified QAE Item

parameters.name: itemIndex
parameters.description: Zero based index - 0 is the currently playing item

parameters.name: chainType
parameters.description: The new chain type to set the item to.

post.summary: Changes the running Log playback Mode

get.summary: Gets the current Log Playback Mode
Gets the full information of the currently playing item from the Scheduled Log
Gets the full information from all items currently loaded into the Log Playback QAE engine

post.summary: Requests Log Playback to be transferred to the specified Destination.

get.summary: Gets the status of the requested Log Playback transfer

post.summary: Cancels the requested Log Playback transfer

get.summary: Gets the names of all open stations
Gets the numeric StationIds of all open stations
Gets the full Station Information for all open stations
Returns the current system time in the local timezone
Returns the current system time in UTC
Returns the current system name
Gets the full details for the currently logged in user
